verses.text: 復興以色列的應許萬軍之耶和華的話臨到我說：

words.note: A title for God, literally 'Lord of myriad armies'.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『我十分熱愛錫安；我為錫安大發烈怒。』

words.note: A title for God, literally 'Lord of myriad armies'.
An idiom meaning to express intense anger.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：『我要返回錫安，住在耶路撒冷裡面；耶路撒冷必稱為「信實之城」，萬軍之耶和華的山必稱為「聖山」。』

words.note: A metaphorical name for Jerusalem.
A title for God, literally 'Lord of myriad armies'.
Often refers to Mount Zion or the temple mount.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『年老的男女必再坐在耶路撒冷的街上；他們因為年紀老邁，各人都手拿拐杖。

words.note: A title for God, literally 'Lord of myriad armies'.

verses.text: 城裡的街上必滿了男孩女孩，在街上嬉戲。』
「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『在那些日子，這事在這餘剩的子民眼中被視為不可能的奇蹟，在我眼中也視為不可能嗎？』這是萬軍之耶和華的宣告。

words.note: Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『看哪！我必從日出之地和日落之地拯救我的子民。

words.note: An interjection commonly used in the Bible to draw attention.
Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 我要把他們領回來，讓他們住在耶路撒冷；他們要作我的子民，我也要憑著信實和公義作他們的 神。』

words.note: Often refers to God's chosen people.
Often refers to divine faithfulness in the Bible.
Often refers to divine righteousness in the Bible.
The raised character indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『在萬軍之耶和華的殿奠立了根基，預備建造的日子，你們這些在當時聽過眾先知親口宣告這些話的人，現在你們的手務要剛強。

words.note: Refers to the Temple in Jerusalem in a biblical context.
Used before collective nouns, e.g., '眾人' (all people).
A strong imperative, often found in formal or religious texts.
Often used in a spiritual or moral sense in scripture.

verses.text: 因為在那些日子以前，人作工是沒有工價的，牲畜也是這樣，並且因有敵人的緣故，人出入就沒有平安，我也使眾人互相攻擊。

words.note: Often carries the deeper meaning of 'shalom' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 但現在我待這些餘剩的子民必不像從前的日子那樣（這是萬軍之耶和華的宣告）。

words.note: Often seen in biblical contexts for 'remnant'.
Literally 'sons and people', common biblical term for God's people.
A divine title. Lit. 'Jehovah of myriad armies'.
Often used for divine pronouncements.

verses.text: 因為五穀必生長繁茂，葡萄樹必結果子，地土必出土產，天也必降下甘露，我要使這些餘剩的子民承受這一切。

words.note: Refers to the five main grains of ancient China, but generally means crops.
A common verb-object compound.
Often symbolic of divine blessing or refreshing.
Often seen in biblical contexts for 'remnant'.
Literally 'sons and people', common biblical term for God's people.
Often used for inheriting blessings or land.

verses.text: 猶大家和以色列家啊！你們從前在萬國中成為可咒詛的，將來，我要拯救你們，使你們成為祝福。你們不要懼怕，你們的手務要剛強。』

words.note: Refers to the kingdom or descendants of Judah.
Refers to the kingdom or descendants of Israel.
A common biblical phrase meaning 'all the nations'.
Commonly used in biblical contexts to describe something under a curse.
A key theological term.
Can be a verb 'to bless' or noun 'a blessing'.
Common injunction in the Bible.
A more emphatic 'must' than 必 or 要 alone.
Commonly used in the Bible for spiritual or physical strength.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『你們的列祖惹我發怒的時候，我曾定意降禍在你們身上，並沒有改變心意（這是萬軍之耶和華說的）；

words.note: A divine title. Lit. 'Jehovah of myriad armies'.
A verb-object compound.
A verb-object compound, 'send down disaster'.
Often used with negation to emphasize 'not... at all'.
Refers to one's thoughts and plans.
A divine title. Lit. 'Jehovah of myriad armies'.

verses.text: 照樣，在這些日子裡，我定意恩待耶路撒冷和猶大家。你們不要懼怕。

words.note: Commonly used for God's gracious treatment of people.
Refers to the kingdom or descendants of Judah.
Common injunction in the Bible.

verses.text: 你們應當行這些事：你們各人要與鄰舍說真話，在你們的城門口要憑著誠實和公正施行審判。

words.note: A more traditional/biblical term for neighbor, '鄰居' is more common today.

verses.text: 你們各人不要心裡圖謀惡事，彼此陷害，也不可好起假誓，因為這些都是我所恨惡的。』這是耶和華的宣告。」
哀哭變成歡樂萬軍之耶和華的話臨到我，說：
「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『四月的禁食、五月的禁食、七月的禁食和十月的禁食都要變為猶大家歡喜快樂的日子和歡樂的節期。所以，你們要喜愛誠實與和平。』
萬民尋求主恩「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『將來還有萬族的人和多個城市的居民要來。
一城的居民到另一城去，對他們說：我們快去懇求耶和華施恩，求告萬軍之耶和華；我們自己也去。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
A title for God, referring to His sovereignty over all creation.

verses.text: 必有很多的民族和強大的國家前來，在耶路撒冷求告萬軍之耶和華，懇求他施恩。』
「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『在那些日子，必有十個說不同方言，來自列國的人，緊抓住一個猶大人的衣襟，說：讓我們與你們同去吧，因為我們聽見 神與你們同在。』」

words.note: Refers to the gentile nations.
Refers to the singular God when capitalized.
Often used in religious contexts for God's presence.
